results.title: The Jackeroo
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Life as a jackeroo on Thylungra Station, a one million acre property in south-western Queensland. The jackeroo tells of the satisfaction of life in the outback. We tour the station and see pelts collected from a trapper, windmills and fences checked, sheep mustered, drafted and sheared, and meet boundary riders. Gives a sense of a hot, dusty and expansive country.

results.title: The Ivory Coast experiment
results.brief_description: A film report showing how television is being used in new ways to teach primary school children and their teachers, even in remote villages of the Ivory Coast in Africa.

results.title: The Israelis
results.brief_description: Examines the current state of the culture and people of the country of Israel. Explores the relationship of Jews and Arabs in the aftermath of recent hostilities, and shows how Israelis relate to their own Jewish heritage.

results.title: The Isle of Rhum
results.creator_credit: Christopher Mylne and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: A film about the Hebridean Island off the coast of Scotland. Here wild natural beauty contrasts with the Edwardian elegance of Kinlock Castle, the Nature Conservancy’s most ambitious experiment.

results.title: The Isle of joy
results.brief_description: Shapes and stars, fish and boats swim, fly and sail across the screen to the music of Claude Debussy (“L’isle Joyeuse”). Paperdoll people change into birds and back again dancing, piping, running, flying. Based on the collages and line drawings of Henri Matisse, this gayly coloured animated film should please every age group.

results.title: The Islanders
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Aspects of life in the Torres Strait Islands, showing the rich culture of the people with their songs and dances, set against bright tropical backgrounds, in striking contrast to many parts of Australia. Shows how strongly the old traditions still affect the people, even though they have modern schools, shops, out-board motors and transistors.

results.title: The Isa
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Andrew J. Helgeson and Cinesound
results.brief_description: A documentary about Mt Isa produced in 1969. The Isa, 30 minutes. Produced for the Mt. Isa Mines Ltd. Mt. Isa mine and city as seen by business men, tourists and residents enjoying life in this new and ever developing mining city in Northern Queensland.

results.title: The Inward eye
results.brief_description: It is difficult for the outsider to understand the astonishing solutions to life that the handicapped can find. Gordon Stent went blind in 1962. He was running his own business, but was forced to give it up. He retired to Bournemouth where he set out to make a new life. There was one thing he wanted to do - he wanted to become an artist - the first blind artist in the world.

results.title: The Invisible planet
results.creator_credit: Mauri Goldberg, National Educational Television and Prism Productions
results.brief_description: This film covers a twenty-four year study of Barnard’s Star, the star nearest to the earth observable from the northern hemisphere, by Doctor Peter Van De Kamp. It also shows the discovery of what is claimed to be the first planet to be found outside our solar system. Suitable for lower secondary level.
